page.title: 03GHOST OF LILLESHALL ABBEY
page.content: In 1932 this appeared in'the Daily Mirror'"{Diviner or Archaeologist who {can locate entrance to underground {passage believed to run from {Lilleshall Abbey will be rewarded Â£50. {Apply in writing to Estate agent, {Lilleshall Hall".}It all began in 1928 when the Custodian moved into a cottage standing on ground once with in the Abbey walls.At night they heard ghostly moanings.They thought it was the men working at Lilleshall Colliery.But the colliery had no works under the Abbey, they got worried. Muffled footsteps could be heard.Then one night the custodians son saw a shadow of a person and noises as if he was turning pages of a book. After years of looking people never found the passage. { }
